service_infos.description: ProtonMail provides tools to delete your account and data permanently.
service_infos.type: How can I delete my data?
points: Navigate to 'Settings' > 'Account' to access the delete account option.
Deleting your account will permanently remove all emails and associated data.
ProtonMail does not retain deleted data due to its zero-access encryption policy.

service_infos.description: ProtonMail encrypts emails end-to-end.
service_infos.type: How are my data used?
points: Emails are encrypted locally before being sent.
ProtonMail does not share your data with third parties.
Only minimal metadata is collected to ensure functionality.

service_infos.description: ProtonMail collects minimal data when you sign up.
service_infos.type: What happens when I sign up?
points: Only an email and password are required for basic accounts.
Optional recovery email or phone number is used solely for account recovery.
No IP addresses are logged.

service_infos.description: ProtonMail has strict policies on who can access your data.
service_infos.type: Who can access my data?
points: Data is encrypted end-to-end, making it inaccessible even to ProtonMail.
Only you have the encryption key to decrypt your emails.
Requests for data by authorities must comply with Swiss law.

service_infos.description: Your data retention is managed securely by ProtonMail.
service_infos.type: How long is my data stored?
points: Emails remain stored as long as you do not delete them.
Deleted emails are removed permanently from servers.
Data backups are encrypted and kept only temporarily.

service_infos.description: ProtonMail ensures robust security to protect your data.
service_infos.type: Is my data secure?
points: Data is encrypted locally before being sent.
Stored data is encrypted with AES-256 encryption.
Servers are located in secure facilities in Switzerland.

service_infos.description: ProtonMail employs the best encryption practices.
service_infos.type: What encryption methods does this service use?
points: End-to-end encryption is applied using OpenPGP standards.
All data at rest is encrypted with AES-256.
TLS ensures secure communication during data transmission.

service_infos.description: ProtonMail supports strong account security measures.
service_infos.type: Does this service support two-factor authentication?
points: Yes, ProtonMail supports two-factor authentication (2FA).
2FA options include TOTP and hardware security keys.
Enabling 2FA significantly enhances account security.

service_infos.description: ProtonMail does not use AI for email processing.
service_infos.type: Does this service use AI?
points: AI is not used for analyzing or processing emails.
No data is used for training AI models.
ProtonMail prioritizes privacy over automation.

service_infos.description: ProtonMail takes ethical approaches with its systems.
service_infos.type: Are there ethical concerns with the service's AI implementation?
points: No ethical concerns as AI is not used.
ProtonMail is transparent about its non-AI stance.
Focus remains on privacy and user control.

service_infos.description: Tips to maximize privacy and security with ProtonMail.
service_infos.type: How to protect myself?
points: Enable two-factor authentication for additional security.
Use a strong, unique password for your account.
Avoid sharing your account recovery email or phone number.
Be cautious with phishing attempts and links in emails.

service_infos.description: Reddit allows you to delete your account and individual posts or comments.
service_infos.type: How can I delete my data?
points: Go to 'User Settings' > 'Account Settings' and select 'Deactivate Account'.
Deleted accounts cannot be recovered, but posts and comments remain unless deleted manually.
For post or comment deletion, navigate to the content and delete it individually.

service_infos.description: Reddit collects data for personalization and advertising.
service_infos.type: How are my data used?
points: Activity is tracked to personalize content and ads.
Reddit uses your data to improve platform performance.
Data is shared with advertisers and partners.

service_infos.description: Basic information is collected during account setup.
service_infos.type: What happens when I sign up?
points: A username and password are required to create an account.
Email is optional but necessary for recovery features.
IP addresses are logged for security and analytics.

service_infos.description: Reddit content is public by default.
service_infos.type: Who can access my data?
points: Posts and comments are public and accessible by anyone.
Admins and moderators have access to reported content.
Advertisers receive aggregated, non-personalized data.

service_infos.description: Reddit retains data as long as your account is active.
service_infos.type: How long is my data stored?
points: Posts and comments remain unless deleted manually.
Deleted accounts are anonymized but some logs may persist.
Retention policies for logs and backups vary by region.

service_infos.description: Reddit employs basic security measures.
service_infos.type: Is my data secure?
points: HTTPS encrypts communication between you and Reddit.
Account breaches have occurred in the past.
Two-factor authentication adds a layer of protection.

service_infos.description: Reddit uses encryption for secure data transmission.
service_infos.type: What encryption methods does this service use?
points: TLS is used to encrypt communication between users and Reddit servers.
Stored data is protected by secure infrastructure.
Encryption details for data at rest are not publicly specified.

service_infos.description: Reddit supports two-factor authentication for account security.
service_infos.type: Does this service support two-factor authentication?
points: Two-factor authentication (2FA) can be enabled in account settings.
2FA options include TOTP via authentication apps.
2FA enhances security against unauthorized access.

service_infos.description: Reddit uses AI for content recommendations and moderation.
service_infos.type: Does this service use AI?
points: AI recommends subreddits and posts based on user activity.
Automated moderation tools enforce community guidelines.
AI is also used to detect and prevent spam and abuse.

service_infos.description: Ethical concerns exist regarding Reddit's AI practices.
service_infos.type: Are there ethical concerns with the service's AI implementation?
points: AI algorithms may create filter bubbles by reinforcing biases.
Concerns exist about AI moderation transparency.
Reddit must balance community needs with AI decision-making.

service_infos.description: Tips to stay safe while using Reddit.
service_infos.type: How to protect myself?
points: Enable two-factor authentication for account security.
Be cautious about sharing personal details in posts.
Regularly review and adjust privacy settings.
Report and block suspicious activity.

service_infos.description: Instagram allows permanent account deletion through its Help Center.
service_infos.type: How can I delete my data?
points: Go to the 'Delete Your Account' page in the Instagram Help Center.
Account deletion permanently removes all photos, videos, and data.
Deleted accounts cannot be recovered, and backups are removed within 30 days.

service_infos.description: Instagram collects and shares data for advertising and personalization.
service_infos.type: How are my data used?
points: Activity and interactions are tracked for targeted ads.
Data is shared across Meta services (Facebook, WhatsApp).
Content interactions are used for recommendations.

points: Requires an email address, phone number, or Facebook account for registration.
Logs IP address and device information during sign-up.

service_infos.description: Instagram’s data-sharing policies allow certain access.

points: Your data is accessible to advertisers for ad targeting.
Meta's internal teams use aggregated data for product improvements.
Government requests for user data must comply with Meta’s policies.

service_infos.description: Instagram retains most user data until manually deleted.
service_infos.type: How long is my data stored?
points: Content like posts and messages are stored indefinitely unless deleted.
Deleted content may remain in backup systems temporarily.
Account deletion permanently removes user data after a grace period.

service_infos.description: Instagram employs encryption and other measures to protect user data.
service_infos.type: Is my data secure?
points: Uses HTTPS to encrypt communication between users and Instagram servers.
Account security can be enhanced with two-factor authentication.
However, past security incidents highlight risks of data breaches.

service_infos.description: Encryption is used for data transmission and storage.
service_infos.type: What encryption methods does this service use?
points: Data in transit is encrypted using TLS protocols.
Stored passwords are hashed and encrypted.
Specific encryption details for other stored data are not disclosed.

service_infos.description: Instagram supports two-factor authentication for added security.
service_infos.type: Does this service support two-factor authentication?
points: Two-factor authentication (2FA) can be enabled in account settings.
Options include SMS codes or authentication apps.
2FA significantly reduces the risk of unauthorized access.

service_infos.description: Instagram uses AI extensively for content recommendations and moderation.
service_infos.type: Does this service use AI?
points: AI analyzes user activity to recommend posts, stories, and reels.
Content moderation relies on AI to flag inappropriate or harmful content.
Ad targeting uses AI to analyze user preferences and behavior.

service_infos.description: Ethical concerns exist regarding AI usage on Instagram.
service_infos.type: Are there ethical concerns with the service's AI implementation?
points: AI algorithms may reinforce echo chambers and biases.

service_infos.description: Tips to maximize privacy and security while using Instagram.
service_infos.type: How to protect myself?
points: Set your account to private to control who can see your content.
Enable two-factor authentication for added account security.
Review and adjust privacy settings regularly.
Be cautious when sharing sensitive personal information.

service_infos.description: Data410 does not collect user data, so there is no personal data to delete.
service_infos.type: How can I delete my data?
points: Data410 processes all data locally or in ephemeral sessions.
No data is stored or retained beyond temporary processing.
If you have concerns, contact support for clarification on privacy.

service_infos.description: Data410 is designed to help users manage their digital footprints without collecting or saving personal data.
service_infos.type: How are my data used?
points: Data410 does not collect or store personal data from its users.
Aggregated visit counts are the only metrics recorded, without any personal identifiers.

points: Data410 does not require account creation for its main tools and features.
If signing up for advanced features, only minimal, non-identifiable data may be collected.
All interactions prioritize user anonymity and privacy.

service_infos.description: Data410 operates transparently and ensures user data remains private.
service_infos.type: Who can access my data?
points: No one, including Data410, has access to your personal data.
Temporary data required for processing is anonymized and discarded immediately.
Aggregated visit counts are stored without any personal details.

service_infos.description: Data410 does not store user data, ensuring maximum privacy.
service_infos.type: How long is my data stored?
points: User data is not stored; all processing is ephemeral.
Temporary logs are used only for troubleshooting and deleted promptly.
Aggregated visit counts remain anonymous and are stored indefinitely.

service_infos.description: Data410 ensures that user activity is secure and private.
service_infos.type: Is my data secure?
points: All interactions are encrypted using HTTPS.
No personal data is stored, ensuring no risk of breaches.
Data processing is done locally or on secured, ephemeral systems.

service_infos.description: Data410 adheres to modern security standards to protect user activity.
service_infos.type: What encryption methods does this service use?
points: All communication is encrypted using TLS.
Temporary session data is securely discarded after processing.
Data stored for debugging or troubleshooting is anonymized.

service_infos.description: Data410 does not require two-factor authentication as it collects no sensitive user data.
service_infos.type: Does this service support two-factor authentication?
points: Two-factor authentication is unnecessary as no accounts or sensitive data are involved.

service_infos.description: Data410 does not use AI in its core operations to ensure transparency and privacy.

service_infos.description: Data410 ensures that any AI used aligns with ethical standards.

points: Current operations have no AI, ensuring no ethical concerns.

service_infos.description: Tips to protect yourself while using Data410 and other online services.
service_infos.type: How to protect myself?
points: Always verify privacy settings on third-party services.
Use strong, unique passwords for any online accounts.
Regularly review your digital footprint for outdated or exposed information.

service_infos.description: Facebook provides account deletion and a tool to download your data.
service_infos.type: How can I delete my data?
points: Navigate to 'Settings & Privacy' > 'Settings' > 'Your Facebook Information' > 'Deactivation and Deletion'.
Choose 'Permanently Delete Account' to remove all data associated with your account.
You can download your Facebook data before deletion through the same menu.

service_infos.description: Facebook uses your data to improve services and target advertising.
service_infos.type: How are my data used?
points: Data is used to personalize your feed and ads.
Your interactions help improve Facebook’s services and algorithms.
Advertisers use your activity for targeted campaigns.

service_infos.description: Facebook collects significant personal data during sign-up.
service_infos.type: What happens when I sign up?
points: You provide personal information like your name, email, and phone number.
Facebook collects your device and location data upon account creation.
Your profile information is used to suggest friends and tailor your experience.

service_infos.description: Facebook allows access to your data under specific conditions.

points: Your data is accessible to advertisers for personalized ads.
Meta employees may access aggregated or anonymized data for analysis.

service_infos.description: Facebook retains your data until it is manually deleted.

service_infos.description: Facebook uses encryption for data protection but has faced challenges with security.

points: 2FA can be enabled in account settings using SMS, authentication apps, or hardware keys.
2FA adds a layer of protection against unauthorized access.

points: AI analyzes your activity to recommend friends, groups, and content.
Content moderation algorithms detect and remove harmful or inappropriate material.
Ad targeting leverages AI to optimize campaign effectiveness.

points: AI algorithms may reinforce echo chambers and misinformation.

points: You must provide your name, email, and professional details.

service_infos.description: Gmail collects basic information during account creation.
service_infos.type: What happens when I sign up?
points: You provide a name, email address, and password.
Gmail collects IP addresses and device data during registration.
Optional recovery email and phone number are used for account security.

service_infos.description: Access to your Gmail data is limited and controlled.
service_infos.type: Who can access my data?
points: Only you and those you explicitly grant access to can read your emails.
Google employees may access data for troubleshooting with strict oversight.
Third-party apps require your explicit consent to access Gmail data.

service_infos.description: Gmail retains your data while your account remains active.
service_infos.type: How long is my data stored?
points: Emails are retained unless you delete them manually.
Deleted emails remain in the Trash folder for 30 days before permanent deletion.
Account data may persist temporarily for legal or recovery purposes.

service_infos.description: Gmail uses robust security measures to protect user data.
service_infos.type: Is my data secure?
points: Data is encrypted in transit using TLS and at rest using AES-256.
Advanced phishing and malware protection is integrated into Gmail.
Google conducts regular security audits to protect user data.

service_infos.description: Gmail employs advanced encryption protocols to protect emails.
service_infos.type: What encryption methods does this service use?
points: Emails are encrypted in transit using Transport Layer Security (TLS).
Stored data is encrypted with AES-256 encryption.
End-to-end encryption is available for Google Workspace customers.

service_infos.description: Gmail supports two-factor authentication for added security.
service_infos.type: Does this service support two-factor authentication?
points: Two-factor authentication (2FA) can be enabled in account settings.
Options include SMS codes, Google Authenticator, and hardware security keys.
2FA provides an additional layer of protection against unauthorized access.

service_infos.description: Gmail uses AI for features like Smart Compose and spam filtering.
service_infos.type: Does this service use AI?
points: AI powers features like Smart Compose and Smart Reply to enhance productivity.
Spam and phishing emails are identified and filtered using AI algorithms.
AI recommends actions like unsubscribing from newsletters you don’t read.

service_infos.description: Gmail's AI usage raises some privacy considerations.
service_infos.type: Are there ethical concerns with the service's AI implementation?
points: AI scans email content for personalized recommendations and features.
There are concerns about how Gmail uses data for AI model improvements.
Google is committed to transparency and user control over data usage.

service_infos.description: Tips to protect your privacy and security while using Gmail.
service_infos.type: How to protect myself?
points: Enable two-factor authentication for enhanced account security.
Review and adjust your Google Account privacy settings.
Be cautious when granting access to third-party apps.
Regularly delete emails containing sensitive information.

service_infos.description: Jira allows admins to delete accounts and associated data.
service_infos.type: How can I delete my data?
points: Go to 'Settings' > 'User Management' and remove users or accounts.
Project admins can delete specific project data like issues and comments.
Contact Atlassian support to request complete account or data deletion.

service_infos.description: Jira collects data to provide collaboration and project management services.
service_infos.type: How are my data used?
points: Data is used to provide features like issue tracking and project collaboration.
User activity and metadata are analyzed to improve platform performance.
Aggregated, anonymized data may be used for analytics and marketing.

service_infos.description: Jira collects basic details during account creation.
service_infos.type: What happens when I sign up?
points: You provide your email address and password during sign-up.
Jira collects metadata like device and IP address for analytics and security.
Additional team and project data is collected during setup.

service_infos.description: Access to Jira data is limited based on user permissions.
service_infos.type: Who can access my data?
points: Project data is accessible only to team members with appropriate permissions.
Admins can manage user access and control visibility within teams.
Atlassian employees may access data for troubleshooting under strict controls.

service_infos.description: Jira retains data as long as the account or subscription is active.
service_infos.type: How long is my data stored?
points: Data is retained as long as your account or subscription remains active.
Deleted data may persist temporarily in backups for recovery purposes.
Atlassian retains minimal data to comply with legal obligations.

service_infos.description: Jira employs security measures to protect project and user data.
service_infos.type: Is my data secure?
points: Data in transit is encrypted using HTTPS.
Regular security audits and compliance certifications ensure data protection.
Two-step verification is available to enhance account security.

service_infos.description: Jira uses advanced encryption protocols for data security.
service_infos.type: What encryption methods does this service use?
points: Data in transit is encrypted using TLS.
Stored data is protected using AES-256 encryption.
Encryption keys are managed securely to prevent unauthorized access.

service_infos.description: Jira supports two-factor authentication for account security.
service_infos.type: Does this service support two-factor authentication?
points: Two-factor authentication (2FA) can be enabled via Atlassian account settings.
Options include TOTP apps or email-based authentication codes.
2FA reduces the risk of unauthorized access to your account.

service_infos.description: Jira uses AI for features like automation and reporting.
service_infos.type: Does this service use AI?
points: AI powers features like automation for workflows and issue tracking.
AI-driven reporting provides insights into project performance.
Machine learning models are used to enhance platform usability.

service_infos.description: Ethical concerns exist with AI automation in Jira.
service_infos.type: Are there ethical concerns with the service's AI implementation?
points: Automated actions may introduce errors or biases in project workflows.
Transparency in AI-driven reporting and recommendations is essential.
Atlassian commits to ethical and user-centric AI development.

service_infos.description: Tips to enhance privacy and security while using Jira.
service_infos.type: How to protect myself?
points: Enable two-factor authentication to secure your account.
Regularly review project and user access permissions.
Be cautious with third-party integrations and validate their security practices.
Avoid storing sensitive information in public project comments or descriptions.
